titleStmt.title: Ho thésauros en ostrakinois skeuesin. A pearl in an oyster-shel: or, pretious treasure put in perishing vessels. The sum or substance of two sermons preached at Withall-Chappel in Worcestershire. Wherein is set forth the mightiness of the Gospel, the meanness of its ministration. Together with a character of Mr. Thomas Hall, his holy life and death. By Richard Moore, a willing, though a most unworthy servant of God in the Gospel of his Son Jesus Christ.
titleStmt.author: Moore, Richard, 1619-1683.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by A.M. for Tho. Parkhurst at the Bible and three Crowns, near Mercers Chappel in Cheapside,

notesStmt.note: The final three p. are an advertisement of books to be sold by Parkhurst.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
